title: Topological Portfolio Selection and Optimization. (arXiv:2310.14881v1 [q-fin.PM])
abstract: Modern portfolio optimization is centered around creating a low-risk portfolio with extensive asset diversification. Following the seminal work of Markowitz, optimal asset allocation can be computed using a constrained optimization model based on empirical covariance. However, covariance is typically estimated from historical lookback observations, and it is prone to noise and may inadequately represent future market behavior. As a remedy, information filtering networks from network science can be used to mitigate the noise in empirical covariance estimation, and therefore, can bring added value to the portfolio construction process. In this paper, we propose the use of the Statistically Robust Information Filtering Network (SR-IFN) which leverages the bootstrapping techniques to eliminate unnecessary edges during the network formation and enhances the network's noise reduction capability further. translated_abstract: 现代组合优化的核心在于创建一个风险低且具有广泛资产多样化的组合。在马科维茨的开创性工作之后，可以使用基于经验协方差的约束优化模型来计算最优资产配置。然而，协方差通常是从历史回溯观察中估计得出的，容易受到噪音的干扰，并且可能不足以准确表示未来的市场行为。作为一种解决方法，可以利用网络科学中的信息过滤网络来减轻经验协方差估计中的噪音，从而为组合构建过程带来附加价值。在本文中，我们提出了使用统计鲁棒信息过滤网络（SR-IFN），它利用自助法来在网络形成过程中消除不必要的边，进一步提高网络的噪音减少能力。我们将SR-IFN应用于美国、英国和中国的指数成分股池，以评估其效果。
tldr: 本文提出了使用统计鲁棒信息过滤网络 (SR-IFN) 来进行组合优化和选择。SR-IFN利用自助法消除不必要的边，减少噪音，从而提高了组合构建过程的价值。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes the use of the Statistically Robust Information Filtering Network (SR-IFN) for portfolio selection and optimization. SR-IFN utilizes bootstrapping techniques to eliminate unnecessary edges, reducing noise and enhancing the value of the portfolio construction process.
